title: Classes and Objects in Java

explanation.short: Classes are blueprints for objects. Java is fully object-oriented - everything must be in a class.
explanation.detailed: Java classes define object templates with fields (data) and methods (behavior). Classes use constructors to initialize objects. Fields should be private with public getter/setter methods (encapsulation). Java supports inheritance with 'extends', interfaces with 'implements', and has access modifiers (public, private, protected). One public class per file, filename must match class name.

key_points: Everything must be in a class in Java
Constructor name must match class name
Use getters and setters for field access
Filename must match public class name
Use 'this' to refer to current object
